intro: Kosteletzkya paniculata, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals and a prominent central disk. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in saline environments. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found along shorelines and in estuaries. Kosteletzkya paniculata is also known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and fluctuating water levels.
